articles.title: Challenging remark
articles.content:
Challenging remark
 Ppyongyang, Mmarch 26 (KCNA) -- Hhirabayashi, chief of the foreign policy deliberation office of the Japanese Cabinet, was recently reported to tell the members of the "society of young dietmen thinking of Japan's prospects and history education" that there is no evidence for the forced recruitment of "Comfort Women for the Japanese Army."
   This is part of the crafty moves of the Japanese reactionaries to conceal the "comfort women" issue and a challenging remark against the Korean and other Asian people calling for historic punishment of the criminals.
   It is a stark historical fact that Japanese imperialism forcibly drafted as many as 200,000 Korean and other Asian women and some European women as sex slaves for its aggression forces. 
   The drafting of "comfort women" is recorded in the aggressive history of Japanese imperialism, which inflicted immeasurable misfortunes and sufferings on the Korean and other Asian people. It has been proved by testimonies of former "comfort women." No one can deny the fact.
   Hirabayashi even said the government was not directly involved in the issue. His remark shows how shamelessly the Japanese reactionaries try to shirk the blame for this criminal issue. 
   Although they intend to settle this issue by giving some money collected from the Japanese people to the surviving "comfort women" through a "private fund," this can never settle the issue.
   Japan must admit government responsibility and apologize for this crime and make state compensation as demanded by the times.

articles.title: Birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung  commemorated abroad
articles.content:
Birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung  commemorated abroad
   Pyongyang, March 26 (KCNA) -- Lecture meetings were recently held in Mali, Nigeria and other countries to commemorate the 85th birth anniversary of the great leader President Kim Il Sung (April 15, 1912).
   The Chairman of the Nigerian National Committee for the Study of Kim Jong Il's Works gave a lecture on the subject of "praise for the peerlessly great man".
   The lecturer said that they recalled again the high international authority and prestige and the undying exploits of President Kim Il Sung, a distinguished leader of the world revolution and an outstanding elder statesman, for the Korean people and the world progressives on the occasion of his birth anniversary.
   The world does not know such a great man as his excellency Kim Il Sung, who performed distinguished exploits without any slightest deviation in a long period from the 1920s till the last moments of his life, the lecturer said, adding:
   During the mourning period,  5,000 million people all over the world expressed condolences over his death and memorial services were held in more than 160 countries.
   The chief of the group for the study of the Juche idea of African students in Mali gave a lecture on the subject of "feats of President Kim Il Sung, who built country for the people".
   The Ukrainian society for the study of the Juche idea organised a show of a DPRK documentary "the great leader comrade Kim Il Sung meets heads of state and prominent public figures of different countries".

articles.title: Floral basket laid before Statue of President Kim Il Sung
articles.content:
Floral basket laid before Statue of President Kim Il Sung
Pyongyang, March 26 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the world Trade Centres Association led by its President Guy F. Tozzoli visited the Statue of the great leader President Kim Il Sung on Mansu Hill to lay a floral basket and make a bow on Tuesday.

articles.title: Press review
articles.content:
Press review
   Pyongyang, March 26 (KCNA -- Rodong Sinmun today reports that the respected Secretary Kim Jong Il, Supreme Commander of the Korean People's Army, extended thanks to servicemen, officials and working people for doing good things for army-people unity.
   Rodong Sinmun carries an editorial titled "party officials, let us be doers in today's general march" and Minju Joson an editorial headlined "officials of national economic organs, let us become standard-bearers in general onward movement of socialism".
   Under the fixed title "they always worked together for the people" Rodong Sinmun  comes out with an article titled "enduring leadership associated with streets of the prospering capital", illustrated by a picture of the great leaders President Kim Il Sung and Secretary Kim Jong Il unfolding a grand blueprint for the construction of the Capital (december 1980).
   "Pride of Kim Il Sung's Nation in having traditions of Juche" is the title of an article in the daily.
   Minju Joson carries articles concerning Secretary Kim Jong Il's words "The respected leader comrade Kim Il Sung is the great leader acclaimed by our people for The first time in their history spanning thousands of years."
   Rodong Sinmun introduces the people who deeply love and sincerely assist servicemen.
   Papers carry news of sowing in rural communities and increased coal production.
   Relief goods were sent to the DPRK by international organizations, foreign countries and organizations, reports the press.
   In a commentary Rodong Sinmun slams the Kim Young Sam group of south Korea for trying to check the democratic forces' anti-"government" struggle.
   In the third instalment of an article exposing the crimes Kim Young Sam has committed over the past four years since he came to power, the daily brands him as a 
civilian-veiled fascist strangling democracy and civil rights.
   In another article the daily accuses the U.S. hawks of escalating dangerous military actions in a bid to stifle the Democratic People's Republic of Korea.
   Minju Joson in an article declares null and void south Korea's "labor law" which was manufactured through deceptive "ruling-opposition negotiations".
   The daily observes the 26th anniversary of the Independence of Bangladesh.

articles.title: Kim Young Sam group lambasted for intensified suppression of Pro-democracy people
articles.content:
Kim Young Sam group lambasted for intensified suppression of Pro-democracy people
  Pyongyang, March 26 (KCNA) -- The Kim Young Sam group of south Korea convened a "meeting of security section chiefs" and discussed further intensifying the suppression of the pro-democracy people.
   Commenting on the fact, Rodong Sinmun today says the move was motivated by the intention to brutally suppress the righteous struggle of students and workers, which is likely to gain momentum in spring, calling it  "illegal" and "pro-north".
   The daily says:
   The puppets  are now seized with uneasiness in face of the people's struggle for a probe of the Hanbo incident and the punishment of its chief culprits and against the retrogressive revision of fascist laws, the struggle which is developing into a fierce anti-Kim Young Sam struggle in combination with the workers' spring struggle for wage hike.
   This is why the fascist clique are desperately trying to arrest the anti-"government" struggle of the pro-democracy people and get out of their serious crisis.
   The "meeting of the security section chiefs" was a prelude to the fascist suppression.

articles.title: Talks between delegations of DPRK and Zimbabwe
articles.content:
Talks between delegations of DPRK and Zimbabwe
   Pyongyang, March 26 (KCNA) -- Talks were held in Harare on march 22 between the government delegations of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea and Zimbabwe.
   At the talks views on a series of matters including relations between the two countries and the non-aligned movement were exchanged.
   The Foreign Minister of Zimbabwe said that the two countries, Zimbabwe and the DPRK, have a solid foundation to steadily consolidate and develop friendly relations.
   He noted that the friendly relations between the two countries are now being continuously developed by the respected Kim Jong Il.
   Present at the talks on the Korean side were members of the DPRK government delegation led by Kim Yong Nam, vice-Premier and Foreign Minister, and on the opposite side were members of the Zimbabwean government delegation led by Stanley Mudenge, Foreign Minister.

articles.title: 26th anniversary of Bangladesh Independence marked
articles.content:
26th anniversary of Bangladesh Independence marked
   Pyongyang, March 26 (KCNA) -- Minju Joson today dedicates an article to the 26th anniversary of the Independence of Bangladesh.
   The Bangladesh people's achievement of  the independence of the country is the fruition of their long struggle for national sovereignty and a great event in the history of the country, the paper says in a signed article.
   The paper stresses that the Korean people extend congratulations and greetings to the Bangladesh people on this day.
   Noting that since the Independence the Bangladesh  people have waged the struggle to achieve national reconciliation and unity and build a new life, the paper says the Korean people sincerely wish the Bangladesh people greater success in their work for national prosperity.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's nation with traditions of Juche
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's nation with traditions of Juche
   Pyongyang, March 26 (KCNA) -- It is with the traditions of Juche that the Korean people could triumphantly advance without slightest deviation along the road chosen by themselves and that they are successfully making the "arduous march" in confrontation with the imperialists, holding the red flag high, says Rodong Sinmun today.
   In an article the daily says the traditions of Juche are the eternal life and blood of Kim Il Sung's nation, source of all victory and glory of socialist Korea and that they are a pride of the nation. It notes:
   They are sacred traditions associated with the greatness, immortal history and feats of  President Kim Il Sung, comrade Kim Jong Suk, who was an indomitable 
revolutionary fighter, and Secretary Kim Jong Il. They are also immortal traditions containing the history of the great start, advance and continuity of the Juche cause.
   The traditions were provided by the integrated whole of the great leaders and the people in the struggle for the freedom and happiness of the people.
   Reflected in the traditions is the steadfast idea of the red flag, the will to complete the Korean revolution in any adversity. And included in the traditions are guidelines for the revolutionaries and people in advancing the revolution victoriously.

articles.title: March 26 plant
articles.content:
March 26 plant
   Pyongyang, March 26 (KCNA) -- The March 26 plant is a major electric line producer of the nation.
   It turns out tens of kinds of lines in hundreds of sizes, including cables for power transmission and communications.
   Situated in Pyongyang, the plant greatly contributes to the economic development of the nation.
   It has provided electric lines to more than 50 major projects including railway electrification and the Anbyon Youth Power Station and various sectors of the national economy.
   The great leader President Kim Il Sung visited the plant many a time on guidance mission.
   At the time of his March 26, 1968 visit, he learned about the production capacity, the technique and skills of workers and electric line production and indicated how the electric line industry of the nation should be developed.
   Later, he sent many technicians and modern machines and facilities to the plant and guided it to turn into a powerful plant responsible for the nation's electric line Industry.
   The plant, covering an area of tens of thousands of square metres, has more than 40 production processes including a low-frequency induction furnace with a capacity of thousands of tons and a copper electrolysis workshop with a capacity of hundreds of tons.
   It has also a college and a school for skilled workers.

articles.title: DPRK praised as paradise of love by s. Korean  teacher
articles.content:
DPRK praised as paradise of love by s. Korean  teacher
  Pyongyang, March 26 (KCNA) -- Jon Hae Song, a dismissed teacher of south Korea, published an article entitled "'paradise' of love, sun of love" in praise of the great leader General Kim Jong Il, said the Seoul-based radio voice of national salvation.
   Pointing out that the scene of desirable education of youth and children is nowhere on the globe to be found, the author of the article said:
   In the literal sense of the word, the north is a paradise of love and the cradle of true education.
   Through impressions given by public figures at home and abroad who had been to the north and its radios, I have believed  that the north is the cradle of true education which is ardently desired by the teachers and parents of students in the south.
   In the north, millions of youths and children are growing stoutly without any depression of spirits. This reality is a result of the tireless efforts and devoted love of the respected President Kim Il Sung and Secretary Kim Jong Il.
   President Kim Il Sung and the leader Kim Jong Il, regarding youths and children as reserves who will shoulder the future destiny of the country and the nation and as the most precious treasure of the country, boundlessly loved the rising generations and devoted themselves to bringing them up well.
   Indeed, the two leaders are suns of love who have brought up the children of the country stoutly and strongly with paternal love, indicated their road with bright lights and built a paradise of love for them.
   A large number of youths and children of south Korea are going in mind to the north, ardently longing for the bosom of the leader Kim Jong Il, the sun of love, in which they can enjoy a worthwhile life.
   It is an unbreakable principle of the nation's contemporary history that the children, the adults and all other people in this land, irrespective of their birthplaces, are yearning after the bosom of Secretary Kim Jong Il, the native place  of the national spirit and the cradle of the eternal life of the fellow countrymen.

articles.title: Greetings to 7th Congress of Communist Party of Denmark(M-L)
articles.content:
Greetings to 7th Congress of Communist Party of Denmark(M-L)
   Pyongyang, March 26 (KCNA) -- The Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea today sent a message of greetings to the 7th Congress of the Communist Party of Denmark (Marxist-Leninist).
   The message expressed belief that the congress will mark an important occasion in the party's activities for peace, socialism and strengthening and development of the Party and that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two parties will further develop on better terms in the idea of independence, peace and friendship.

articles.title: SPA Chairman meets Thai parliamentary delegation
articles.content:
SPA Chairman meets Thai parliamentary delegation
  Pyongyang, March 26 (KCNA) -- Yang Hyong Sop, Chairman of the Supreme People's Assembly, met and had a friendly talk with a delegation of the Thai parliament led by Sophon Phetsawang, first deputy-speaker of the house of representatives, who paid a courtesy call on him, at the Mansudae assembly hall today.
   Present there were Paek In Jun, Vice-Chairman of the Supreme People's Assembly, and officials concerned.
   The head of the delegation said he could know well of the idea founded by the great President Kim Il Sung and developed by Secretary  Kim Jong Il.
   They are great men who see into the future, he added.

articles.title: Talks between DPRK and Thai parliamentary delegations
articles.content:
Talks between DPRK and Thai parliamentary delegations
   Pyongyang, March 26 (KCNA) -- Talks were held between delegations of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly led by its Vice-Chairman Paek In Jun and the Thai parliament led by first deputy-speaker of the house of representatives Sophon Phetsawang at the Mansudae Assembly Hall today.
   The two sides at the talks discussed development of the friendly relations between the parliaments and peoples of the two countries and a series of matters of common concern.
   The talks took place in a friendly atmosphere.
